channel.title: Dell laptop batteries
channel.description:
So, my Dell laptop battery has reached 50% wear(after about a year), and everytime I turn on my laptop, a little message pops up to annoy me telling me so. I decide, what the hell, I'll see how much they cost and pester my mum to buy one for me, they can't cost more than £20-30 right? Wrong, just to replace the 9 cell battery I have, with 5Wh less than the one I got now, costs a fucking ridiculous [b]$232.665[/b] USD, or [b]£113.98[/b] GBP! I can buy the fucking laptop again for less than £400!
So, what do I do? Opt for the 6 cell? Still a whopping [b]$172.710[/b], [b]£84.60[/b], or do I risk buying a 9 Cell, 85Wh battery off ebay claiming to be genuine at [b]£33.84[/b], over [b]£80[/b] cheaper than the one on Dell's site, and potentially put my life in danger? (I'm sure you've all see the "Exploding Dell" video)

item.title: Dell laptop batteries
item.dc:creator: @Enjoy_me_now Enjoy me now
item.description:
@Enjoy_me_now wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:148514”][quote author=Enjoy me now link=topic=203453.msg1795979#msg1795979 date=1191371513]
what you should do is diccharge your battery all the way so it dies
then charge it again all the way

repeat this cycle like 5 times your battery life will go up by 25-40%

Dont say im making this up my dads a master computer technision
[/quote]
sure, but when it comes to common sense, your dad is an idiot

i can watch almost 2 full movies without mine dieing…

you sure know how to contribute to a thread[/quote]

your the idoit you dont ven now what half the stuff what in the comp. i wonder if you have a masters in comp tec. i think not.

and common snece i tried it and it saved me money. So common sence you shut your mouth before you say something stupid

Read full topic

item.title: Dell laptop batteries
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Schizzo:

Are you sure that you’re not just running more processes and doing more or your laptop now? I noticed that my battery time varied rather significantly depending on what I was actually doing on the computer.

It’s 2 hours doing what I normally do, JUST squeezing 3 with no internet, lightweight word processing and lowest screen brightness, as well as my processors on half speed!

Read full topic

item.title: Dell laptop batteries
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Bobby:

im sure mom and pop stores ahve the battery right? try and buy from a small store and negotiate the price

It would be very unlikely to find a Dell in a store, let alone a specific battery for under £34.

item.title: Dell laptop batteries
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

The only thing I can do right about now is NEVER use the battery I got now unless I need to, it’s got 2 hours average on it from 8, and I’ve drained it down to about 4% no more than 20 times.

Read full topic

item.title: Dell laptop batteries
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

The Un-Named:

how does that work out?

I’m not sure, we are dealing with Dell here.

Seriously though, if your issue is that the batteries are too expensive (which I understand and I agree with you) then maybe you should take a chance on the battery from E-Bay. Other than that, I’m not sure what more you can do other than just buying some more, expensive batteries.

Read full topic

item.title: Dell laptop batteries
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Schizzo:

I’ve had my Dell laptop for a few months and my battery is fine (I use my AC outlet whenever possible, which is most of the time). If I were you, I’d just be safe and purchase the 6 cell from Dell.

My battery is fully functional, but that’s not the point, with the cost of 3 9 cell batteries from dell, I could buy the laptop again(really pushing the price here), that means the whole laptop minus the battery cost £200, how does that work out?

Read full topic
